content.description: Climbs a dirty crack to a top-out on slopers and edges. Lots of lichen on this problem which makes it a bit slippery.
content.protection: A spotter is helpful on this problem.
content.location:
South face of the boulder between

Problem A

and

Problem M

and directly behind a large pine tree.

content.description:
Lieback up a short left-facing flake taking care near the top as you mantel through the tree branches. Useful as a downclimb.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

Lieback up a fractured right-facing flake taking care near the top as you mantel up through the tree branches. Also useful as a downclimb.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #361, Unnamed.
content.location:
Left side of the east face and just left of

Problem K

.

content.description:
SDS at a short right-facing flake and work up past a black intrusion sidepull, and a useful knob for your foot, to the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Center of the east face between

Problem K

and

Problem J

.

content.description:
Starts off a sloping rock and works sidepulls up to a good edge in a dark waterstreak before the standard mantel finish. A little dirty but will clean up with more traffic.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Right side of the east face and just right of

Problem K

.

content.description:
Start from two thin edges and work up the featured face to an incut lip.

This problem isn't listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Left of center between

Problem G

and

Problem I

.

content.description:
Follow featured face up the prominent black waterstreak/groove to a juggy lip encounter.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #359, Unnamed.
content.location:
Just left of

Problem F

up a black groove.

content.description:
Climb up jugs and a seam past an upside down heart-shaped depression in the rock.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #358, Unnamed.
content.location:
Left of center on the north face and just left of

Problem E

.

content.description:
Start just right of a rock at the base and work up a sculpted rib on great rock.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #360, Unnamed.
content.location:
Left side of the north face and just left of

Problem H

.

content.description:
Stand (or sit) and climb the cracked patina to a juggy finish with a bad landing over a boulder.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #357, Unnamed.
content.location: Right side of the north face.

content.description:
SDS at a curving flake and lieback up the surprisingly tricky corner to gain jugs leading to the top. Sequential movement with some polished footholds down low.

A spotter is nice because of the lieback moves and the large rock directly behind the problem.

* Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #356, Unnamed.
content.location:
Left side of the west face and left of

Problem C

.

content.description:
Start from crimps at the top of curving flake and works over a bulge with thin feet to gain an undercling/lieback flake and better footholds higher.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #355, Unnamed.
content.location:
Center of west face between

Problem B

and D.

content.description:
Starts from a oblong black knob and a good sidepull rail to pass a horizontal before the crux balance move as you stand up to reach jugs just out of reach. Technical movement on this problem which can be done from a SDS at the same grade.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #354, Unnamed.
content.location:
Center of the west face between

Problem A

and C.

content.description:
Climbs the obvious offset via liebacking to a finish on jugs. Can be done from a sit at V0+.

Listed in the Tram Bouldering Guide as #353, Unnamed.
content.location: Right side of the west face and left of a large pine tree.

content.description: SDS on a rectangular hold at the bottom of problem E, and traverse over to the bottom of the black water streak on good holds, with some fun moves, and finish up problem G.
content.location: Starts at the bottom of Problem E and finishes up Problem G
